claims.text: A BBC News video reports the First Lady of Ukraine Olena Zelenska is trying to claim political asylum in a European country in order to escape an “aggravated relationship” with President Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: Fake BBC report claims Ukraine’s first lady tried to escape abroad – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The BBC confirmed this is not a genuine report by the outlet, and we could find no credible reporting of these claims.

claims.text: A Captured Ukrainian soldier did not know that he was carrying a consent form for an organ transplant, servicemen of the North military group told RIA Novosti

claimReview.title: Fact-check: Did Ukrainian Soldiers Sign Organ Harvesting Consent Forms Disguised as Medical Papers?

claims.text: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu Proposed to Resettle Gaza Residents to Ukraine and Syria

claimReview.title: Fake: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu Proposed to Resettle Gaza Residents to Ukraine and Syria
claimReview.textualRating: The statement about the proposal of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to resettle the population of Gaza to Ukraine and Syria is a fake.

claims.text: Video shows a $20 million mansion owned by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: This Video Does Not Show Zelenskyyss $20 Million Mansion in Florida

claims.text: Ukraine Seeks to Buy Uranium from Niger to Develop Nuclear Weapons

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Seeks to Buy Uranium from Niger to Develop Nuclear Weapons
claimReview.textualRating: This claim, made by propagandists citing African media, is false - mainly because Defence Minister Rustem Umerov did not visit Niger in November 2023. Moreover, by the end of 2024, the French company Orano had lost control of uranium mining in Niger, and the country's main uranium buyers are now Russia and China.

claims.text: Ukrainian Soldier Admits that Ukrainian Forces ‘Killed Children in Sudzha’

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukrainian Soldier Admits that Ukrainian Forces ‘Killed Children in Sudzha’
claimReview.textualRating: The claim circulating on Russian platforms that a Ukrainian soldier allegedly confessed to killing a child near Sudzha is either fake or at least unverified. The message was posted on a Facebook account that, according to available data, previously belonged to Ukrainian soldier Artur Yakovitskyi. His family has reported him missing - according to open sources, he disappeared near the settlement of Sudzha on 28 February 2025. On 28 March, a suspicious post appeared on his Facebook page, allegedly containing a confession to the murder. On 1 April, a screenshot of this post began actively circulating on pro-Russian Telegram channels. The image of the "murdered teenager" attached to the post was likely generated by artificial intelligence - this is supported by the analysis results of several AI detection tools.

claims.text: BBC Labels Valerii Zaluzhnyi 'Next President of Ukraine'

claimReview.title: Fake: BBC Labels Valerii Zaluzhnyi 'Next President of Ukraine'
claimReview.textualRating: The claim that BBC News labelled a photo of Ukraine's Ambassador to the UK, Valerii Zaluzhnyi, as the "next president of Ukraine" is unfounded and constitutes disinformation. The screenshot, purportedly taken from a BBC News broadcast, has been faked.

claims.text: Putin says no ceasefire with Ukraine unless Duterte is freed from ICC.

claimReview.title: Fabricated news article frames Duterte's arrest as obstacle to Russia-Ukraine ceasefire

claims.text: A UK regional newspaper says 70,000 Ukrainian Soldiers died in Kursk.

claimReview.title: Fake front page Ukraine story linked to Russian disinformation
claimReview.textualRating: False. The newspaper front page is fake.

claims.text: Ukraine's Presidential Office Claims EU ‘Owes’ Ukraine for Security

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine's Presidential Office Claims EU ‘Owes’ Ukraine for Security
claimReview.textualRating: The propagandists fabricated a screenshot of a Ukrainian news article with a quote purporting to be from Mykhailo Podolyak, an adviser to the head of the Ukrainian presidential administration, saying that EU countries 'owe' Ukraine for security. In reality, Podolyak said that each country independently determines the amount of military assistance Ukraine can expect.

claims.text: Hull Daily Mail cover about 70,000 Ukrainian soldiers dying in Kursk Oblast "in vain"

claimReview.title: No, Hull Daily Mail didn’t write about 70,000 Ukrainian soldiers killed in Kursk Oblast
claimReview.textualRating: Not a real cover for Hull Daily Mail. The real issue was dedicated to a teenager stabbing another teenager 10 times, not to Kursk Oblast.

claims.text: Elon Musk, billionaire and Trump’s head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) claimed that Ukraine is “guilty” of making “everybody” hate him on Fox News.

claimReview.title: Fact-check. No, Musk didn’t say it’s Ukraine’s fault “that everyone hates” him on Fox News
claimReview.textualRating: Fake. The authors actually used the screenshot from the exclusive interview Donald Trump and Elon Musk did for the Hannity show on Fox News. Musk didn't mentioned Ukraine in this show. Original subtitle say, "Musk: America will go bankrupt if we don’t solve the deficit."

claims.text: France Refused to Provide CIA with Information on Ukrainian Corrupt Officials — Euronews

claimReview.title: Fake: France Refused to Provide CIA with Information on Ukrainian Corrupt Officials — Euronews
claimReview.textualRating: Neither Euronews nor any other trustworthy source has reported such an incident.

claims.text: An image and video shows European leaders taking off their suit jackets as a show of support for Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: Video of European leaders removing jackets in solidarity with Zelenskyy is AI – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: False. The image isn’t real. It is a still from a video that was created using artificial intelligence.

claims.text: Ukraine 'Violated Obligation to Maintain Energy Ceasefire'

claimReview.title: Manipulation: Ukraine 'Violated Obligation to Maintain Energy Ceasefire'
claimReview.textualRating: Russia itself has not stopped attacking Ukraine's energy and civilian infrastructure for a single day - neither after Zelenskyy's promise to stop such attacks, nor after Putin's conversation with Donald Trump, during which the Russian leader supposedly ordered a halt to attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities. After the alleged 'agreement to stop strikes', Russia continues to launch more than a hundred attack drones into Ukraine every day, targeting energy facilities, among other targets. The most massive attacks after the agreement between Putin and Trump were Russian strikes on the regions of Kropyvnytskyi, Odesa, Zaporizhzhya, Donetsk, Sumy and Kyiv regions.

claims.text: Video shows Ukrainian soldier videotaping his last moment before an airstrike.

claimReview.title: No, video doesn't show Ukraine soldier recording his last moments

claims.text: Mark Rubio threatens to 'cut off Ukraine's Starlink access.'

claimReview.title: No, Rubio didn't threaten to cut off Ukraine's Starlink access

claims.text: Russia Shot Down Its Own Drones Over Ukraine After Trump's Conversation with Putin

claimReview.title: Fake: Russia Shot Down Its Own Drones Over Ukraine After Trump's Conversation with Putin
claimReview.textualRating: Despite the unsubstantiated statements of the Russian Defenсe Ministry, Russia continued shelling Ukraine even after the US President talked on the phone with the Kremlin leader. Energy infrastructure in the Donetsk and Dnipropetrovsk regions was shelled. In total on the night of March 18-19, 2025, 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and four S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles, as well as 145 Shahed strike UAVs were launched over Ukraine.

claims.text: A post shared on Facebook claims that European leaders took off their suit jackets in support of Ukraine.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, European Leaders Didn’t Take Off Suit Jackets In Support Of Ukraine
FACT CHECK: No, European Leaders Didn’t Take Off Suit Jackets In Support Of Ukraine

claims.text: Says Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy “engaged in election interference by campaigning” in Pennsylvania for former Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris.

claimReview.title: Was Zelenskyy's Pennsylvania visit ‘election interference’? Why experts say no

claims.text: A Hull Daily Mail cover said thousands of Ukrainians died in Kursk

claimReview.title: Fake newspaper cover on Ukrainian soldiers in Kursk spreads online

claims.text: A post shared on X claims a British outlet reported 70,000 Ukrainian troops died in Kursk.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: No, Outlet Did Not Report 70,000 Ukrainian Troops Died In Kursk

claims.text: This image shows an authentic headline by Hull Daily Mail that reads, "70,000 Ukrainian soldiers in the Kursk region died in vain," from March 13, 2025.

claimReview.title: Fake Hull Daily Mail headline about Ukrainian casualties

claims.text: 2022 video of Ukrainian marines surrendering in Mariupol falsely shared as recent incident from Kursk region of Russia

claimReview.title: PTI Fact Check: 2022 video of Ukrainian marines surrendering in Mariupol falsely shared as recent incident from Kursk region of Russia

claims.text: Image captioned "European Leaders took off their suits to support Ukraine!!" shows authentic event

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Edited Image Shows European Leaders Taking Off Their Suit Coats In Support Of Ukraine -- No Actual Video

claims.text: 'Zelenskyy regime' is Responsible for Murders and Disappearances of Journalists in Ukraine - RSF

claimReview.title: Fake: 'Zelenskyy Regime' is Responsible for Murders and Disappearances of Journalists in Ukraine - RSF
claimReview.textualRating: The video is fake. To create it, the propagandists used artificial intelligence.

claims.text: Reportedly Mass Ukrainian surrenders in the Kursk region. America stopped sharing intelligence and hit the pause button on more military aid.

claimReview.title: 2022 Video of Mariupol Surrender Misattributed to Kursk Events

claims.text: A video shows the Ukrainian flag being flown from the top of the Statue of Liberty.

claimReview.title: Video of Ukrainian flag on Statue of Liberty is fake – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is not a real video. A watermark in the bottom right corner suggests it was made by OpenAI’s text-to-video artificial intelligence model, Sora.

claims.text: Deceased InfoWars reporter Jamie White was on a “Ukrainian enemies hit list.”

claimReview.title: InfoWars reporter Jamie White, who was fatally shot, was not on Ukrainian enemies list

claims.text: A video shows Ukrainian troops surrendering in the Kursk region on 11 March 2025.

claimReview.title: Old video shared as recent footage of Ukrainian troops ‘surrendering’ in Kursk – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The clip predates this and has been shared online since at least April 2022.

claims.text: As of February 2025, the United States had given $350 billion in military aid to Ukraine for its war with Russia.

claimReview.title: Trump falsely claimed US spent $350B on military aid to Ukraine

claims.text: InfoWars Journalist Murdered Shortly After Ukraine 'Put Him On Their Kill List'

claimReview.title: Fake: InfoWars Journalist Murdered Shortly After Ukraine 'Put Him On Their Kill List'
claimReview.textualRating: The journalist was not on Ukraine's so-called kill list or in the Myrotvorets database. His sister and local police believe that his death was unrelated to his journalistic activities.

claims.text: Jews in Amsterdam celebrating the establishment of a new Jewish state in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Video Does Not Show Jews Celebrating the Establishment of a Jewish State in Ukraine

claims.text: Warren Buffett has given more than $500 million to Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Warren Buffett did not send more than $500M to Ukraine — but his son did

claims.text: Video shows London rally backing Trump's efforts to end war in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Old UK rally footage falsely linked to Donald Trump's Ukraine war policy

claims.text: A video shows Donald Trump calling Ukraine’s leader “Temu Zelensky” for not wearing a suit.

claimReview.title: Trump's 'Temu Zelenskiy' taunt is an AI deepfake
claimReview.textualRating: The video is an AI deepfake from a self-described parody account.

claims.text: U.S. Vice President JD Vance's cousin Nate Vance fought in Ukraine for three years during its war with Russia.

claimReview.title: Yes, Vice President JD Vance's cousin Nate fought in Ukraine for three years

claims.text: A compilation video shows five clips of the Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy dancing.

claimReview.title: A compilation video of Zelenskyy dancing includes clips that aren’t of him – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The first clip actually shows Argentinian dancer Pablo Acosta, while the second has been manipulated using Artificial Intelligence (AI) to superimpose President Zelenskyy’s face onto the dancer’s to create a deepfake. The other clips are genuine, however.

claims.text: The video shows Ukrainian soldiers surrendering in huge numbers in the Kursk region on March 11, 2025.

claimReview.title: Old video of Ukraine soldiers surrendering shared as recent

claims.text: L'Etat va prendre notre épargne pour financer la guerre en Ukraine

claimReview.title: Revisions for Non, l'Etat ne va pas "piquer" l'épargne des Français pour financer des investissements de défense | AFP Factuel
Non, l'Etat ne va pas "piquer" l'épargne des Français pour financer des investissements de défense

claims.text: Ukrainians bowing to President Zelensky on his return from US

claimReview.title: Clip shows memorial for fallen soldier, not Zelensky's return from Washington

claims.text: Video shows Ukrainian cameraman crying during Zelensky-Trump meet

claimReview.title: Revisions for Video of cameraman in tears falsely linked to fiery Trump-Zelensky spat | AFP Factuel
Video of cameraman in tears falsely linked to fiery Trump-Zelensky spat

claims.text: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and a journalist had an exchange about the impending peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Exchange between U.S. defense official and journalist on Ukraine-Russia FAKE

claims.text: Audio shows a BBC reporter making a vulgar comment about an Oval Office meeting between President Donald Trump and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: Audio of BBC reporter making snide comment about the Trump-Zelenskyy meeting is fake

claims.text: A video shows people being made up to look like war-torn Ukrainian soldiers to get more US funding.

claimReview.title: Ukrainian soldiers falsely accused of faking combat for sympathy
claimReview.textualRating: False. The clip shows behind-the-scenes footage from the making of a music video.

claims.text: Ukraine “soldiers” have resorted to faking combat in order to appear “war torn” so the slush fund from the U.S. keeps churning money their way!

claimReview.title: Music Video Footage Shared as Staged Combat scenes

claims.text: Clips show Ukrainian soldiers faking combat to appear “war torn” in order to receive US funds.

claimReview.title: Viral clip shows filming of a music video, not Ukrainian soldiers ‘faking combat’ to secure US funds – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The clips actually show behind-the-scenes footage from a music video about the Ukraine war.

claims.text: President Zelensky recently broke his fast with Ukrainian Muslim soldiers.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Video Of Zelensky’s Iftar With Ukrainian Soldiers Is From 2023, Not Recent

claims.text: Marco Rubio said he would convince Elon Musk to pull Starlink from Ukraine

claimReview.title: Fake Marco Rubio audio on Starlink, Ukraine spreads online

claims.text: Zelenskyy saying the U.S. will have “to send their sons and daughters” to die for Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Misleading Video of Zelenskyy Saying the U.S. To ‘Send Their Sons and Daughters to War’

claims.text: Zelenskyy saying the U.S. will have “to send their sons and daughters” to die for Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Misleading Video of Zelenskyy Saying the U.S. To ‘Send Their Sons and Daughters to War’

claims.text: The Ukrainian parliament is preparing to pass a new bill making 14yo eligible for mobilisation.

claimReview.title: The Ukrainian parliament is NOT preparing to pass a new bill making 14-year-olds eligible for mobilization or registration

claims.text: Image shows a transcript of the White House meeting between US president Donald Trump, vice-president JD Vance and Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Fake Transcript Of Fiery Trump-Zelenskyy Exchange In Oval Office Goes Viral

claims.text: Ukraine's flag was displayed on the statue of liberty.

claimReview.title: AI-generated Video of Ukraine's Flag on the Statue of Liberty Circulates Online

claims.text: BBC Ukraine correspondent James Waterhouse was caught on a hot mic after the meeting of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Donald Trump in the White House, saying: “This is the second time ever that a US president ****s someone in the Oval Office.”

claimReview.title: Video appearing to show BBC reporter caught on hot mic after Zelenskyy-Trump meeting has been edited – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This audio clip has been faked. Mr Waterhouse says it is AI-generated, and a full clip of the report shows no such comments were broadcast.

claims.text: Ukraine Launched a Massive Bot Attack on YouTube

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Launched a Massive Bot Attack on YouTube
claimReview.textualRating: Wired has never published such claims, and the video itself was probably created using AI. The fake is noticeably different from the outlet's official style: it lacks the characteristic title, and the footage used is of poor quality. StopFake's journalists found no evidence of such a bot campaign; instead, they discovered that after Zelensky's meeting with Trump, Russian propaganda stepped up the spread of deepfakes, doctored screenshots, and fake videos bearing the logos of well-known media outlets to sow dissension among Ukraine's allies and demoralise Ukrainian society.

claims.text: Pro-Ukrainian Rallies in the US Organized by Criminal Gangs

claimReview.title: Fake: Pro-Ukrainian Rallies in the US Organized by Criminal Gangs
claimReview.textualRating: There is no proof of this. Neither Donald Trump nor anyone from his administration made such statements.

claims.text: Ukraine was caught faking combat scenes to ask for more money from the US

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Viral Clip Of Ukrainian Soldier Applying Make-up Is From A Music Video, Not Fake War Scene

claims.text: A video shows the moment President Zelenskyy said “f*** him” when asked about President Donald Trump’s latest comments on Ukraine before entering Number 10 Downing Street.

claimReview.title: Downing Street video doesn’t show Volodymyr Zelenskyy using expletive to refer to Donald Trump – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The clip is misleading, and this isn’t what President Zelenskyy said. He responded to a journalist by saying: “I’m OK, thank you so much”, and did not utter an expletive.

claims.text: A video shows Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy saying the US will have to send their sons and daughters to fight in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Zelenskyy did not say the US will have to send their sons and daughters to fight in Ukraine – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This clip is from 2023 and has been taken out of context. In the full video, Mr Zelenskyy discusses how Ukraine losing the war would risk Russia invading Baltic NATO member states, potentially leading to US involvement on the ground.

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told U.S. President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance during their contentious February 2025 Oval Office meeting, “You're raising the volume of your voice, but not the logic of your argument."

claimReview.title: Zelenskyy didn't exactly say 'raising volume of your voice' but not 'your logic' in Trump meeting

claims.text: Video shows Ukrainian flag hoisted on Statue of Liberty torch in New York

claimReview.title: Fact Check: AI Video Shows Ukrainian Flag Hoisted On Statue Of Liberty Torch

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing bombs, claiming he was signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza.

claimReview.title: This Image Does Not Show Zelenskyy Signing Bombs for Gaza

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy owns 15 homes including a $35 million home in Florida, has $1.2 billion in an overseas bank account, owns 15 homes, three private planes and has a monthly income of $11 million.

claimReview.title: The facts behind resurfaced claim that Zelenskyy has multiple homes, planes, offshore accounts

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the U.S. will have "to send their sons and daughters" to die for Ukraine after having a heated exchange with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House in February 2025.

claimReview.title: Zelenskyy saying US will have to send 'sons and daughters to war' in Ukraine is from old video

claims.text: Europe's aid to Ukraine "was in the form of a loan. They get their money back and we didn't."

claimReview.title: Trump Exaggerates on U.S. and European Aid to Ukraine, Loans

claims.text: Video shows Ukrainian soldiers faking battle conditions

claimReview.title: Clip shows music video shoot, not staged Ukrainian battlefield

claims.text: The video shows Ukraine soldiers faking war with Russia to get funds from the U.S.

claimReview.title: BTS clip from a music video falsely shared as Ukraine faking war

claims.text: Former President of Poland Lech Wałęsa wrote a letter to Donald Trump criticizing the U.S. President's decision to suspend the delivery of all U.S. military aid to Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Yes, former Polish president Lech Wałęsa wrote letter to Trump about pausing military aid to Ukraine

claims.text: Video shows the Ukrainian flag being hoisted on the Statue of Liberty torch in New York, U.S.

claimReview.title: Video doesn't show Ukrainian flag on Statue of Liberty in New York

claims.text: Ukraine was caught faking combat scenes to ask for more money from the US.

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Music video BTS goes viral as Ukrainian soldiers fake combat for US funds

claims.text: Ukraine Stopped Using the Starlink System and Insulted Elon Musk — UNITED24

claimReview.title: Fake: Ukraine Stopped Using the Starlink System and Insulted Elon Musk — UNITED24
claimReview.textualRating: UNITED24 did not report such information, and neither did any other credible source.

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said to reporters of U.S. President Donald Trump either "F*** him" or "F*** Trump," just prior to greeting U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer outside 10 Downing Street in London in March 2025.

claimReview.title: Video doesn't show Zelenskyy using expletive about Trump outside 10 Downing Street

claims.text: Ukraine soldiers have resorted to faking combat in order to appear war torn so the slush fund from the US keeps churning money their way

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Video Does NOT Show Soldiers In Ukraine Faking Combat -- They Are Acting In A Music Video

claims.text: WSJ Reports That US Has Refused to Pay for Stay of Ukrainian Delegation

claimReview.title: Fake: WSJ Reports That US Has Refused to Pay for Stay of Ukrainian Delegation
claimReview.textualRating: This information is fake, as the Wall Street Journal never published such an article, and the screenshot circulating online is a fake.

claims.text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy wore a suit in a meeting with Karl Schwab World Economic Forum executive chairman

claimReview.title: Fact Check: Zelenskyy Did NOT Wear Suit In Meeting With Klaus Schwab After February 2025 White House Visit

claims.text: a Russian special operations team ambushed an English-speaking Ukrainian patrol.

claimReview.title: Video of Russian Ambush on Ukrainian Patrol is Misleading

claims.text: "The Ukrainian Maidan ... for most Georgians has become a symbol of the destruction of a nation."

claimReview.title: Georgian speaker misleads on Georgians’ support for Ukraine

claims.text: Volodymyr Zelenskiy has blocked access to Trump's Truth Social across Ukraine.

claimReview.title: Truth Social ban falsehood pushed by Russian media
claimReview.textualRating: False. Truth Social has never been available in Ukraine.

claims.text: A post shared on X claims to show Russians ambushing American fighters in Ukraine.

claimReview.title: FACT CHECK: Video Shows Airsoft Production, Not Russian Ambush Of Americans In Ukraine
